nano.remexp
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.Parser

public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object

This Parser handles events and executes the CommandExecutors on demand.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Constructor Detail

Parser

public Parser(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,CommandExecutor> newCommands)
Initializes an object of this class and stores the hash table that was passed.

Parameters:
newCommands - The commands-to-CommandExecutor hash table.
Method Detail

extractTags

public static java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extractTags(java.lang.String commandLine)
Splits a string up and stores it in a Hashtable as key value pairs. The whole string is split by the standard delimiters (" \t\n\r\f"). Each of these tokens is split by '=' and stored in a hash table as key=value pair.

Parameters:
commandLine - The string to be parsed (e.g. "command=adjustaxis name=x value=100").
Returns:
A hash table containing key=value pairs.

executedCommand

public boolean executedCommand(java.lang.String commandLine)
Tries to find the value for the key "command" in the given string and tries to execute the CommandExecutor for the appropriate command.

Parameters:
commandLine - the string containing the command, e.g. "command=start".

isValidCommand

public boolean isValidCommand(java.lang.String command)
Returns true if the command is recognized by this parser, false if not.

Parameters:
command - The command we want to check for validity, e.g. goto2, calibratestage,...
Returns:
true if the command is valid for this parser, else false.

getValue

public static java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String msg,
                                        java.lang.String cmd)
Searches for the value for the command tag.

Parameters:
msg - The string holding the command=value pair.
Returns:
The value if the command exists, else null.
